profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-04-19 16:14:30 -0400.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Use of original papers requires an appointment and is limited to the Archives' Washington, D.C., Research Center. Microfilmed materials must be consulted on microfilm.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A journal; writings; lists of photographs; photographs; and printed material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: REEL 2910: A journal, 1933; and two "literary papers" from 1934 titled NAIVETE for which Grossman was editor and contributor, often signing his pieces "El Cid".

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: REEL 3361: 2 press releases and a clipping, concerning an exhibition of Grossman's work; lists of photographs; photographs taken by Grossman, 1949-1954, of art-related activities in Provincetown, 1950-1952, of the Kootz Gallery, 1954, of Highfield, 1952, and of artists including: Seymour Lipton, Chaim Gross, Hans Hofmann, Ruth Reeves, Jack Hall, Bobbie and Dagmar Lilian, and Weegee.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm reel 2910 available for use through interlibrary loan.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm reel 3361 available for use through interlibrary loan.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: Reel 2910: Originals returned to the lender, Miriam Grossman Cohen, after microfilming.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Photographer, writer; New York, N.Y. and Provincetown, Mass.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Material on reel 2910 lent for microfilming 1982 and material on reel 3361 donated 1985 by Grossman's widow, Miriam Cohen.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Microfilmed as part of the Archives of American Art's Texas project.
